column1: #Text=James Armistead Lafayette ( born 1748 [ 1 ] or 1760 [ 2 ] – died 1830 [ 1 ] or 1832 ) [ 2 ] was an enslaved African American who served the Continental Army during the American Revolutionary War under the Marquis de Lafayette . [ 3 ]

#Text=As a double agent , he was responsible for reporting the activities of Benedict Arnold – after he had defected to the British – and of Lord Cornwallis during the run-up to the Battle of Yorktown .
#Text=He fed the British false information while disclosing very accurate and detailed accounts to the Americans .
#Text=Armistead , an enslaved man , was owned by William Armistead of Virginia .
#Text=Most sources indicate that James Armistead was born in 1748 in New Kent County , Virginia , [ 1 ] though others put his birth around 1760 . [ 2 ]
#Text=In 1781 , after getting his master 's consent , Armistead volunteered to join the army under Lafayette .
#Text=Lafayette utilized Armistead as a spy , with the latter posing as a runaway slave .
#Text=Armistead joined the camp of Brigadier General Benedict Arnold , the turncoat who was leading some British forces in the area .
#Text=Pretending to be a spy for them allowed Armistead to gain Arnold 's confidence to the extent that Arnold used him to guide British troops through local roads .
#Text=" The ex-slave , who later renamed himself James Armistead Lafayette in the general 's honor , served as a double agent against the British under the avowedly anti-slavery Lafayette .

#Text=At that time , he added  Lafayette " to his name to honor the general . [ 5 ]

column1: #Text=James Armistead Lafayette continued to live in New Kent County with his new wife , one son and several other children and became a wealthy farmer . [ 9 ] [ 10 ]
#Text=In 1818 , he applied to the state legislature for financial aid ; he was granted $ 60 for present relief and a $ 40 annual pension for his services in the Revolutionary War .
#Text=He died in Baltimore in 1830 [ 1 ] or in Virginia in 1832 . [ 2 ]
